name: Teddy Bear Sunflower
climate: Prefers temperate climates with moderate rainfall and cool nights.
Can adapt to warmer regions if given enough moisture and care.
Does not thrive in extreme hot or cold environments for long periods.
Best suited for regions with distinct seasons and mild summers.
sunlight: Requires full sun to thrive, ideally 6 to 8 hours of direct sunlight daily.
Limited sunlight may result in stunted growth and fewer blooms.
Can tolerate partial shade but will have diminished flowering capacity.
Placing in an open area ensures maximum exposure to necessary sunlight.
watering: Needs regular watering, especially during dry spells or hot weather.
Soil should remain consistently moist but not waterlogged to avoid rot.
Infrequent deep watering is preferable to light, frequent sprinklings.
Mulching can help retain moisture and reduce the need for frequent watering.
soil: Grows best in well-draining, fertile soil with plenty of organic material.
Slightly acidic to neutral pH levels are optimal for nutrient absorption.
Heavy clay soils should be amended with sand and compost to improve drainage.
Regularly test soil for nutrient levels to ensure balanced fertility.
extra_care_tip: Deadheading spent blooms encourages more flowers and prolonged blooming.
Staking may be necessary in windy areas to prevent stems from breaking.
Regularly inspect for pests such as aphids and caterpillars and address promptly.
Rotating planting locations yearly helps prevent soilborne diseases common to sunflowers.
